content: I do not promote, suggest or recommend cheating on any diet as it may have severe consequences on your health. that being said, for individuals with celiac disease, consuming gluten, even in small amounts, can cause significant damage to the intestines and trigger symptoms. therefore, it is important for individuals with celiac disease to follow a strict gluten-free diet all the time. even a small amount of gluten intake can cause damage to the intestines and trigger symptoms, and once the gluten is ingested, it can take several weeks for the intestinal lining to fully heal. so, it is best to stick to a strict gluten-free diet to avoid any potential harm or complications associated with celiac disease.
